metadata.title: CVE-2020-0427 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In create_pinctrl of core.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due toa use after free. This could lead to local information disclosure with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-140550171

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-88-generic - 4.15.0-88.88
linux-image-4.15.0-88-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-88.88
linux-image-4.15.0-88-lowlatency - 4.15.0-88.88
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-88-generic - 4.15.0-88.88
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-88-lowlatency - 4.15.0-88.88
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-88.88').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-40.32~18.04.1').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1053.53').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.62').
